name: Cook the Book: Deviled Eggs with Smoked Salmon
description: While perusing the pages of Eric Ripert's Avec Eric, I came across these Deviled Eggs with Smoked Salmon, the perfect hors d'oeuvre to snack on while the turkey is roasting.
recipeIngredient: Fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Place the eggs in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring the water to a boil, then cover and remove from the heat. Let the eggs sit in the hot water, covered, for 12 to 15 minutes. Drain the hot water and run cold water over the boiled eggs until cool.
Peel the eggs and cut each egg in half lengthwise. Gently remove the yolks from the center and place them in a small mixing bowl. Set the egg white halves aside.

Add the smoked salmon, crème fraîche, chives and mustard to the egg yolks and stir to combine. Season to taste with salt, black pepper and cayenne pepper. Squeeze enough of the lemon juice into the yolk mixture to season to taste.
Spoon the yolk mixture back into the egg whites. Garnish with paprika and serve.
